definitions.definition: to ask God to protect somebody/something

examples.text: They brought the children to Jesus and he blessed them.

definitions.definition: to make something holy by saying a prayer over it

examples.text: The priest blessed the bread and wine.

definitions.definition: to call God holy; to praise God

examples.text: We bless your holy name, O Lord.
Bless my soul! Here comes Bill!
‘Where's Joe?’ ‘I'm blessed if I know!’ *(= I don't know)*

definitions.definition: to have something good such as ability, great happiness, etc.

examples.text: We're blessed with five lovely grandchildren.

definitions.definition: said to somebody after they have sneezed
used to show that you are pleased with somebody, especially because of something they have done

examples.text: Sarah, bless her, had made a cup of tea.

definitions.definition: used when you are leaving somebody, to say that you hope they will be safe, etc.

wordOrigin: Old English blēdsian, blētsian, based on blōd ‘blood’ (i.e. originally perhaps ‘mark or consecrate with blood’). The meaning was influenced by its being used to translate Latin benedicere ‘to praise, worship’, and later by association with bliss.
